com.vernalis.knime.internal.flowcontrol.nodes.timedloops.abstrct.loopstart

Class AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.NodeDialogPane
      • org.knime.core.node.defaultnodesettings.DefaultNodeSettingsPane
        • com.vernalis.knime.internal.flowcontrol.nodes.timedloops.abstrct.loopstart.AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoopStartChunkForTimeNodeDialog, LoopStartChunkToTimeNodeDialog, LoopStartTableRowToVarLoopForTimeNodeDialog, LoopStartTableRowToVarLoopToTimeNodeDialog, WaitForTimeNodeDialog, WaitToTimeNodeDialog

    public abstract class AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog
extends org.knime.core.node.defaultnodesettings.DefaultNodeSettingsPane
    Abstract Node Dialog class for Timed Loop start nodes. Provides methods for adding dialog panes and creating settings models.
    Author:
    S.Roughley

    • Field Detail

      • m_onMissing

        protected static org.knime.core.node.defaultnodesettings.SettingsModelString m_onMissing
        Settings model for the missing value policy. Is null unless set by the #createMissingVariablePanel() method.

      • m_missingDouble

        protected static org.knime.core.node.defaultnodesettings.SettingsModelDouble m_missingDouble
        Settings model for the missing double value. Is null unless set by the #createMissingVariablePanel() method.

        Settings model for the missing integer value. Is null unless set by the #createMissingVariablePanel() method.

      • m_missingString

        protected static org.knime.core.node.defaultnodesettings.SettingsModelString m_missingString

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog

        protected AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog()
        Simplest initiation, adding no panels to the dialog.

      • AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog

        protected AbstractTimedLoopStartNodeDialog(boolean isRunToTime)
        Simple Start Timed Loop Node Dialog panel. A chunk size panel is created, and either a run-to-time or run-for-time expiry time panel. Finally a iteration counter start panel is added.
        Parameters:
        isRunToTime - True if Run-to-time node, or False if Run-for-time

    • Method Detail

      • addChunkSizePanel

        protected void addChunkSizePanel()
        Adds a simple dialogue group to ask the user for the number of rows to be processed in each chunk.

      • addRunToTimePanel

        protected void addRunToTimePanel()
        Creates a time entry dialogue group for 'Run-to-time' nodes. Should be followed by a call to addZerothIterationCountPanel().
        See Also:
        #createRunForTimePanel()

      • addRunForTimePanel

        protected void addRunForTimePanel()
        Creates a time entry dialogue group for 'Run-for-time' nodes. Should be followed by a call to addZerothIterationCountPanel().
        See Also:
        #createRunToTimePanel();

      • addZerothIterationCountPanel

        protected void addZerothIterationCountPanel()
        Adds a dialog component for the start value of the iteration counter. Normally this should immediately follow a call to either addRunToTimePanel() or addRunForTimePanel().

      • addMissingVariablePanel

        protected void addMissingVariablePanel()
        Creates a panel to select the behaviour of missing variables, and supply default values if appropriate.

      • updateDefaultsStatus

        public static void updateDefaultsStatus()
        Update the enabled status of the Settings Models.
